questions.query: How does your project contribute to the advancement of the Web3 grants ecosystem?
questions.explanation: Development of Web3 Grants tooling

questions.query: Describe your previous work or plans related to the Web3 grants ecosystem.
questions.explanation:
ggframe will operate as Open Source Software (OSS) and a public good to further encourage funding for public goods. By leveraging the Gitcoin platform, our goal is to facilitate the funding of millions to tens of millions of dollars for OSS and public goods through ggframe in the future.

I'm working at Fracton ventures research, I usually research how to use Ethereum to solve problems related to public goods. As part of our activities, we have written a report article on how to build a Positive sum world, and a report of A Retrospective Quantitative Review of Crypto Grants Programs
https://research.fracton.ventures/reports/positive-sum-design-with-crypto/
https://research.fracton.ventures/reports/a-retrospective-quantitative-review-of-crypto-grants-programs

Also I have personally participated in many hackathons, and each time I have built a product related to public goods funding.

Eternal Commons at ETH Global Superhack and won 2nd prize from Optimism | Funding tool for OSS public goods that any communitiy can easily run RetroPGF and Eternal Commons at ETH Global Superhack and won 2nd prize fr
https://ethglobal.com/showcase/eternal-commons-dnt9j

FluidFunding at ETH Global Tokyo and won 2 more prizes from UMA, curvegrid etc | Prediction market based Quadratic Funding Protocol for public good projects.
https://ethglobal.com/showcase/prediction-based-quadratic-funding-protocol-vrasm

PledgePost at EthGlobal Online2023 | PledgePost aims to create a sustainable and equitable funding mechanism for article posts and provide writers with the opportunity to earn income from their contributions. 
https://ethglobal.com/showcase/pledgepost-eeyus

questions.query: How does your project create value for the Web3 grants ecosystem?
questions.explanation:
Open Source Software (OSS) and public goods developers often face financial challenges because they are not associated with any specific country. This disconnect from national structures means they don't benefit from the redistribution mechanisms typically managed by governments. Consequently, these developers struggle to receive the financial rewards they deserve.

Imagine a future where Gitcoin is seamlessly integrated with social media: developers of OSS and public goods can use ggframe to encourage users to donate without leaving their social media platforms. Users simply discover ggframe, enter their donation amount, click a button, and complete their donation, significantly improving the user experience (UX).

Currently, platforms like Twitter are used for promoting donations. With ggframe, donations can be solicited directly on social media channels.

ggframe allows users to donate directly to Gitcoin Grants on Farcaster-supported chains such as Base, Arbitrum, and Optimism without leaving the app. Originally, users had to donate through explore.gitcoin.co, but ggframe directly interacts with the Allo V2 contract used by Gitcoin Grants, ensuring secure and easy donations!

questions.query: How do you plan to share insights, methodologies, or tools developed through your project with the Cartographer Syndicate and the broader Web3 grants community?
questions.explanation: ggframe is organized as a public goods for public goods. so anyone can fork and contribute to ggframe. I would like to use the funds obtained through GG21 to grow ggframe into a more user-friendly product. I believe that good products are derived from pluralistic connections.

questions.query: How does your project contribute to the advancement of the Arbitrum ecosystem?
questions.explanation: dApps & Apps

questions.query: Describe your previous work or plans related to the Arbitrum ecosystem. How does your project strengthen Arbitrum's foundational infrastructure, improve developer efficiency, or accelerate the adoption of novel applications?
questions.explanation:
ggframe is a farcaster frame application that accelerates donations to the Gitcoin Grant. Many Gitcoin Rounds are currently being deployed on arbitrum one, which generates a lot of tx through ggframe and improves the profitability of arbitrum one. As a result, more pubilc goods and OSS that further support arbitrum one will be funded. These are positive externalities not only for the arbitrum ecosystem, but also for Ethereum and other blockchain ecosystems.

ggframe will operate as Open Source Software (OSS) and a public good to further encourage funding for public goods. By leveraging the Gitcoin platform, our goal is to facilitate the funding of millions to tens of millions of dollars for OSS and public goods through ggframe in the future.

questions.query: How does your project focus on building on, integrating with, or supporting the Allo Protocol ecosystem? Please provide specific examples of your work and plans.
questions.explanation: ggframe natively supports Allo, and ggframe's growth means increased transaction value in Allo.

questions.query: Describe your project's current status and roadmap. Are you actively developing on Allo Protocol, or do you have a clear plan for future integration?
questions.explanation: ggframe is already live, and in the future, ggframe plans to support many Allo strategies other than QF like superfluid streaming.

questions.query: Outline your plans for community engagement and user adoption. How will you contribute to expanding the Allo ecosystem?
questions.explanation:
ggframe offers users the easiest way to interact with Allo. Users can complete Allo operations without simply leaving social.
Also, since ggframe is OSS, it helps other builders build on top of Allo.

questions.query: How do you envision your project driving GMV (Gross Merchandise Value) through the Allo protocol? Please provide potential metrics or estimates.
questions.explanation: needless to say, ggframe increase GMV of Allo
